description: soap +â€Ž berry: the fleshy part of the fruit was used in washing linen.

entries.meaning: Any woody plant of the genus Sapindus, which is eponymous of the Sapindaceae family
The fruit of such a plant, especially of the tree Sapindus saponaria.
examples: Soapberries are rich enough in saponin to be used as soap substitute, hence their name.
